Reviews.Title: “True Gem”
Reviews.Author: library1200
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an old renovated building that was updated and very modern. We were initally put off by the $15.00 a night parking fee so we did not rent a car. There was parking across the street that was free but we walked and used the bus line for sight seeing and did not miss having a car. The bus stop- the Charm City Line- was just 1 building down and ran every 20 minutes and was FREE!, clean not overcrowded and convient. We also found out that the area restaurants used shuttle services to get you to and from their restaurants. The hotel had a breakfast area with waffles and ingredients for egg sandwiches, cereal, fresh fruit, bagels, and pastries. They allowed us to keep leftovers from the restaurant in their coolers and we heated it up ourselves the next night. Otherwise no restaurant on site. All of the staff was helpful and friendly, giving answers about the sights and how to get to them. The only down side since we did not rent a car was getting from the airport to the hotel- no shuttle service but there were shuttles that went from the airport directly to the hotel for a fee.

Reviews.Title: “positive comment”
Reviews.Author: Cat G
Reviews.Content: It was very pleasant,clean. No signs of bed bugs. I could actually understand the staff. They seemed to be Americans that spoke english. It didn't stink of garlic and strange spices and the staff seemed to leave there families at home instead of having them run thru the lobby wildly. It was nice and friendly almost like home.Comfortable. Parking was a little cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the value”
Reviews.Author: beefweef
Reviews.Content: First time to Baltimore in a long time. I wanted to be close to everything, but not break the bank. This hotel defines value. Great staff, simple, clean, updated rooms (meaning new furniture, new lighting fixtures, flatscreen on wall, not a 4:3 TV on a wooden wardrobe.) Breakfast was sufficient, and I'm excited to hear that Choice Hotels is upgrading their free breakfast in July 2012, so it'll be even better. My only issue was parking...just not enough. Their lot is small, and if I'm paying $15/day, I want a guaranteed spot. Luckily, I was able to snag one every time I returned to the hotel. But at the end of the day, you want a clean hotel with a clean (and comfortable) bed as well as a responsive, respectful staff for an affordable price. This place has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and great!”
Reviews.Author: Work2Play_11
Reviews.Content: Very close to inner harbor, this hotel was reasonably priced and very clean. Rooms were a little smaller than the usual size but still adequate. Read trip advisory reviews before booking and they were very helpful. Parking area was very smal but staff said if we went out and couldn't find a spot, they would refund our parking fee and that metered parking across the street was free for the overnight hours. Fortunately, we did find a spot. Very clean and bathrooms were good. Computer in lobby so you can cheek area maps or other things. There were homeless in the area (as stated by others) nut they were never a problem. We would stay again if in the area. Went to aquarium. That was also great!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place, but don't spend too much”
Reviews.Author: Metsfan1
Reviews.Content: We visit Baltimore at least once a year, usually to see a game and this year I was able to get a great rate at the Sleep Inn. We had previously stayed at the Holiday Inn Express next door so we were familiar with the location. The hotel is easy enough to get to, and is close to many things, although I'm not sure you would want to walk to any of them. Power Plant might be the one exception, but if you were coming back late I'm not sure about that one. We made it to the hotel early in the afternoon so we could head to dinner prior to the ballgame, and before leaving I asked for advise on taking a cab, or parking near the stadium since no shuttle is available (The Holiday Inn offers a shuttle to the Harbor, and Stadium). And while the girls at the desk were nice, they were unable to help. They also could not guarantee that a parking space that I paid for ($15) would be available when I returned. The room was very nice, but breakfast only being available from 6-9 seemed a little odd, and our floor became very noisy at 8am. We could hear the arrival and departure of the elevator, along with music in another room, girls in the hallway, and the cleaners. I understand some people like to get up and out early, but as we were only returning home it would have been nice to relax with some peace and quiet. That being said, I never did have a problem parking, and the staff was friendly. You will have to drive or take a cab everywhere, but if I could get a similar rate I would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: pkbw59
Reviews.Content: My family was in Baltimore for a dance competition at the Inner Harbor Marriott, and I chose the Sleep Inn based on reviews on TripAdvisor. It offered the best combination of lowest price, close proximity to the competition, and most positive reviews. Traveling with two other families, we all arrived by taxi from the airport prior to the check in time, and having requested early check in, we were at first told there were no rooms ready. I had also modified my booking (through booking.com) weeks before arrival with no apparent problem, but found on checking in that the modification had resulted in a duplicate reservation, at a higher rate than originally booked, and this caused confusion and delay. Mr. Bassiouni repeatedly asked me if I was parking a car (a $15 charge per day) and I said no each time. I had called 4 days before arrival to check on my reservation, and request that all the families in our group could be put on the same floor. This seemed to be a problem too, but ultimately it was worked out. My family's room was quite small compared to the others I saw, but adequate for our needs. It was quiet and clean although there were quite a few spots on the carpet. We did hear neighboring guests some of the time, but mostly it was very quiet. My bed was a bit saggy in the middle and the pillows were very lumpy. I particularly didn't like the bed linens...they were the crispy kind that make a crunchy noise whenever you move. The pillow was like sleeping on a bag of potato chips...I tried all four on my bed and they were all the same, and were rather small too. So I didn't sleep as well as I had hoped, but my other family members did, so not everyone would be bothered by the sheets and pillows. The free breakfast is standard at all the Sleep Inns, not exciting but plenty to fill you up. The breakfast attendant is a nice gentleman and interacts cheerfully with everyone. We were able to walk to the Inner Harbor, although we took taxis when going to the competition. I would not recommend walking around the area after dark. The waterfront is busy and touristy, but the farther away you go the more it's like any big city. There is a church just down the street from the hotel where homeless people gather. They didn't bother us but it can feel a bit insecure to travelers. There is a free Circulator bus that stops very close by that may be helpful for getting around but it doesn't go all the way to the waterfront. The connecting routes are a bit inconvenient, I thought. We also went to Washington D.C. by Amtrak from Penn Station, which is not far, but you would not want to walk there either. The taxi drivers are a bit crazy and everyone drives way over the speed limit, police included. We heard lots of sirens in the city when out and about. The hotel has an affiliated limo service that happened to be there one day, and the driver offered to take us to Penn Station for the same cost as the taxi had the day before. It was a much nicer way to travel! We also used the limo to go to the airport for $35 and it was wonderful. If you ask the hotel can give you his contact information. It's much less than renting a car, and parking is very expensive in the city. Upon check out we found that we had been charged for parking each day, but Mr. Cunningham removed it and was very helpful and pleasant. If we return to Baltimore we would most likely stay at the Sleep Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, Cavernous, I mean Cavernous Room. But Furniture?”
Reviews.Author: jbcapecod
Reviews.Content: Traveling this time with our two small dogs, we needed a pet friendly place, and we also wanted to be close to the harbor area. Rejected one place for being really pricy with mixed reviews. Found this. In an old refurbished building, with very, very high ceilings. Not a nice part of town, in spite of proximity to the harbor: street persons asleep on benches virtually outside of the hotel at night. Not threatening, just unsettling when panhandled, which happened to us twice. BUT, the hotel itself was an island of safety: enclosed parking, very attentive staff. Very modern. Dog floor was on floor one. Our room was, as we requested, close to a back (keyed) entrance. Room was as high to ceilings as it was big in other dimensions (also big.) However, when we came in, there was: (1.) a large modern King bed; (2.) a large 30 something inch flat screen HDTV attached to the wall; (3.) one desk chair; in front of (4.) one relatively small desk. That was it. To the right of the bed as one faced that wall was perhaps 130 Ft. squared of nothing except bare carpeted floor. Exec. king, but no refrigerator. etc. I walked to the front desk and asked Glenn (who should get a medal) for a fridge and another chair. No problem, he said. Both came almost immediately -- the fridge from ? and the chair wheeled in from -- yes -- the lobby! Still felt like living in a (VERY) spacious tomb, but it was a bit better. The wife -- who likes things stark and uncluttered -- loved it. The dogs did not care: both small, they get to sleep on the big comfortable King bed anyway. I felt like something out of a sci-fi movie in which my soul was being sucked away by very clean blacks, grays, whites, and nothing. So why did this a "very good" rating? Because it was very VERY clean -- sterile. Because the desk service was spectacularly helpful -- thank you, Glenn. And because, I think that the management will at some point adequately furnish this property -- they are clearly trying.

Reviews.Title: “marc"s first stay at the sleep inn”
Reviews.Author: marc m
Reviews.Content: The assistant general manager Gamal was quite helpful in assisting me with my late night check in on friday 1/23/12, Gamal & Kelly made me feel like there was no problem in satisfying any of my needs while staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: brandon p
Reviews.Content: the reviews of this hotel are all true! stayed at Sleep Inn for 3 nights and it was just great. The room is extremely clean and modern. the beds are very comfortable, the staff is exceptional and doesnt hesitate to fulfill any of your requests. the walk down to the inner harbor is very short, 5-10 min maybe. would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent big city experience”
Reviews.Author: suehav
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Sleep Inn and Suites before and they are always very clean and tastefully decorated. This one was no different. Easy access from I-83 and just blocks from the Inner Harbor. I had an appointment at John Hopkins our first day there and the hotel had a free shuttle to and from the hospital - although it was a short half hour walk away, it was relaxing to be driven. We did walk to the Inner Harbor afterwards and it was only a 7 minute walk. The beds at the hotel were very comfortable. Wonderful soft sheets and nice pillows! They offered a free breakfast with lots of variety. Our only complaint was that like most hotels, the sound carried from the room next to us and the people there, came home both nights after 1 am and were noisy for several hours afterwards. I have to come back for a surgical procedure in May and we plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Kitten395
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. We were greeted by a pleasant gentleman in the evening that went out of his way to accommodate us with garbage bags for our bikes. In the mirning we got a great big hello from the breakfast staff and the food was good. The rooms were clean and the beds super comfy. The lobby was beautiful and clean. The mirning staff just as nice! Upon check out the girl at the counter also went above and beyond to help me with a lost earing backing. I would deff go back to this place and would highly recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “best experience!”
Reviews.Author: Megan S
Reviews.Content: hello im a real person not management or know any staff personally! I am not gonna go in to detail about how great my stay was im just gonna say it was the best hotel ive ever been to at such a low price very updated hotel impressive room i saw about 2 dif. rooms got a free upgrade n a bottle of complimentary wine bathroom was huggggggeeeeeee so was the bed room! staff was great i forgot the guys name but he looked Hispanic he is the man with a plan! the man u go to! he gets it done! i think my facebook is attached to this review feel free to ask questions!

Reviews.Title: “Great STAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Allan W
Reviews.Content: We got a room here because we had a concert over at Rams Head Live, a short 5 minute walk to power plant live. Great breakfast setup. Room was amazing, not huge but just what u need. The shower was amazing as well. The staff member that helped us at check and breakfast the next day was awesome. The parking lot is really small and it cost 15 bucks, which i wouldve payed if there was a spot. U can park on the street for free until 8AM then u have to go feed the meter, during the week anyways, not sure if they charge meters on weekend. U do have to walk past a small park filled with homeless people but they didnt bother us at all

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Night at Sleep Inn”
Reviews.Author: ret1
Reviews.Content: I chose this Sleep Inn because it was close to Mercy Hospital where my son was having surgery the next day. I made an excellent choice. My room on the first floor, as I requested, was huge! The gentleman at the front desk was super helpful and did everything to make my stay comfortable. I would certainly come back to this hotel should I need to stay in Baltimore again. One word on the location....It isn't really that near the Inner Harbor. I was told that it was about four blocks away. It seemed like more to me. I definitely would not have walked to the Inner Harbor alone. It wasn't a terrible part of town but not a good one either. There was no dinner service and no restaurants I felt comfortable walking to alone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: rosalie86
Reviews.Content: My friends and I visited Baltimore for a concert at Rams Head Live! We found out about the Sleep Inn & Suites on the Rams Head Live website. We received a special discounted rate, and the hotel is located just a short 5 minute walk to the venue. All the staff were so friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is modern and very clean. The breakfast also had sausage and egg which was a nice suprise! I will defifinitely be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “couldn't ask more ..”
Reviews.Author: bbugsinspec
Reviews.Content: Me and my girl friend were on 15 day road trip traveling north and we stayed in 4 different hotels including one off the nice casino hotels Atlantic city.but while coming back from NY we decided to spend a night in Baltimore. we found this hotel online with a gr8 deal and turnout to be best of all them. Cool interior, like the type writer in the lobby. Location of the hotel was very good walking distance harbor, friendly staff, no begs )),large room very clean,comfortable bed,excellent breakfast meaning couldn't ask more ..

Reviews.Title: “Fire hazard”
Reviews.Author: Tlgt1234
Reviews.Content: It's midnight and I am kept awake by the chirping of our smoke detector. I reported the problem to the front desk and they told me to see if I could reach it and remove the battery...... Looks like I won't be making it to their insanely early (ends at 9am) to eat cold hard boiled eggs and toast. Bad, bad hotel. Terrible service. Would never come back even for $5 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Stay”
Reviews.Author: luvfiddling
Reviews.Content: This Sleep Inn is fairly new, clean as a whistle, with one of the friendliest staff we have met recently. They use a shuttle service to Johns Hopkins that is first rate and free, any time of day or night. This hotel is also basically in walking distance to Inner Harbor. We usually stay at Comfort Inns, but this is just as nice and cheaper. A keeper!

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: kelahk
Reviews.Content: We booked a Saturday night here to enjoy Baltimore's Inner Harbor before embarking on a cruise. We booked the park and sail package. When we arrived at about 8 or 9 PM, we found that the Sleep Inn had given our room away. Not because we were late, but because they overbooked in case someone didn't show. And as my husband was at the front desk of this hotel, a man was going ballistic because he had two rooms and both toilets had been backed up for 3 hours - with no response from maintenance. They moved us to another Sleep Inn, which is not owned by the same owner and was quite dumpy. It was out of town, far from the Inner Harbor. Yes, they gave us a discount but it was not worth it because they were unapologetic, we lost out on our half-day at the Inner Harbor, and it took us almost an hour to find the place (even with a GPS). One other comment: It is a few blocks from the Inner Harbor, but you won't want to walk there because you'll go through a not-so-good area. .

Reviews.Title: “Superior Stay”
Reviews.Author: SHNLL4013
Reviews.Content: I'm an employee of johns Hopkins and stayed one night at the Sleep Inn & Suites Downtown Inner harbor. I didn't realize that it was so close to johns Hopkins until I arrived.... I could have walked. The staff was nice, hotel was comfortable and the rooms were cleaned. I stayed in the suite with the jacuzzi and a bottle of wine was brought up from the staff. Sheets were clean and bed was comfortable! Parking lot available for parking. This was a very nice stay and I would recommend and Hopkins staff or patient who is looking for a place to stay, this would be IT! I definitely would recommend this place to my patients and I personally would stay again!!! Thanks Lucy and Abraham :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for the Cost”
Reviews.Author: grateful_travels
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, this hotel was pretty good. I was a little skeptical at first since other rooms in Baltimore go for much more, but any concerns I had were completely unfounded. We liked that the hotel is a short walk to the Inner Harbor, the Power Plant and several other bars, restaurants and venues. If you're not a walker, it's a quick $5 cab ride to most places within the downtown area. The inside of the hotel is very new, well decorated and clean. Our room was a bit basic, but served its purpose as a place to sleep and shower. The furnishings were nice and modern. We didn't have a refrigerator, which was fine for us, but if you want one, you'll need to book above the lowest class of rooms. The only complaint we have is that the walls seem thin, and it was a bit loud during sleeping hours. We could hear the water running in the room next to ours - so loud that it woke us. We could also hear people talking in the next room over. They seemed to be talking at a normal level, not overly loudly, but I could make out every word of the conversation. As we are MD residents and only traveled to Baltimore for a concert, we thought this was a great value. Well worth staying over and not driving back home after the show. We would definitely stay here again if the rates stay the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mark1055
Reviews.Content: Came to Baltimore for a job interview and stayed here for 2 nights. Not being familiar with "sleep inn" being from NJ, i decided to give it a shot, and it was great. Rooms are like new and it is in a perfect location. The staff made you feel like home! The only negative part was the hotels parking lot was very small, and has less spaces then rooms. I wouldn't trust parking on the side streets so keep an eye on the parking lot and move into it once someone leaves.

Reviews.Title: “PRE-CRUISE GOOD DEAL”
Reviews.Author: CEBB
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed one Saturday night, prior to leaving out of Port of Baltimore. Not sure how busy the area would be during the week, saw a Juvenile Justice Court 1/2 block away out our window facing the parking lot. Room/bathroom were clean and nicely decorated. The breakfast was good and restocked frequently. Parking was no problem, even with a large SUV. We could have walked the few blocks to Fell's Point, Chinatown & HarborPlace, but it was raining/sleeting and cold/windy. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “out-of-town family stayed here”
Reviews.Author: turnthepage_10
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here while I was moving to a different apartment within Baltimore. I was very pleased with how nice their stay was at this Sleep Inn. They really enjoyed the breakfast. The rooms were spacious and clean. The hotel is new-ish so everything just looked nice, polished not "dingy" or "tired." I even felt safe with my parents' car being parked in the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks you!!! Thank you!!! Thank you!!!”
Reviews.Author: sandra_2360
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sleep Inn & Suites Downtown Inner Harbor with my fiancé 2/17 - 2/19 and had the best time. The rooms were clean, the complimentary breakfast was good, but most important, the staff was excellent!!! Abraham, the manager was absolutely the best. He made you feel like family and was patient when it came to directions, things to do, restaurants to eat at and made sure we had everything we needed. The location was convenient from Penn Station and about 4 blocks from the harbor. I will definitely be going back and this will always be my hotel of choice when in Baltimore. Thanks again Abraham and staff for a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “New, modern, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi141
Reviews.Content: Found this nice hotel searching online. Stayed one night and without a car. Good location. Quiet location. Room was very spacious and,although it lacked a table and chairs, it did have a nice desk and ergonomic chair. First hotel where lighting was decent! Good breakfast featuring eggs, bagels, cereals, toaster, waffles, etc. Pleasant dining area. Coffee available all night. Excellent desk clerks. One block to bus stop!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great price, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before, but it was a great experience so I want to leave a note. The hotel is an easy 5 to 10 minute walk to the harbor, Fells Point, and Little Italy. They had no problem with me parking my car in their lot a few hours before check in time so that we could get started with our day without having to move the car later. The service was great when we did eventually make it back to the room. Everyone was very nice and very polite, it was refreshing to feel that they were actually happy to see me in the hotel. Even with the hotel filled to capacity for a Ravins game, they still made time to cover the little details that make staying in a hotel enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “best deal out there!”
Reviews.Author: ceebake
Reviews.Content: i went to college in towson, and im familiar with the area and hotel prices. i took a chance on this one, solely based on the ranking on tripadvisor, since it was half the price of the other inner harbor hotels. BEST DECISION I MADE. everything is new, the room was very clean and had everything i needed. theres even a little sign in the bathroom to tell you that if youve forgotten any toiletries, to call the front desk and theyll give you what you need (in addition to the usual shampoo, lotion, and soap). the continental breakfast was GREAT - not your typical cereals and pastries (even though they were there), but also a waffle maker, scrambled eggs, sausage, a bunch of different juices. to be honest with you - the surrounding buildings on the block are sketchy, but i had no problems with the neighborhood. its basically across from power plant live, and all of the streets are pedestrian friendly (cross walks and lights). it took me five minutes to walk to the aquarium. i will absolutely be staying here in the future. also, fresh lemonade in the lobby and also computers to use. i didnt need to use them, i brought my laptop - they have free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “no sound-proofing, no sleep at the Sleep Inn”
Reviews.Author: adam h
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights, and 2 of them were the worst hotel experiences of my life. The Friday night, our neighbors were screaming and blasting their TV until 4am, which meant I got to do my conference presentation on 1.5 hours of sleep. At least they shut up after a call to the front desk after asking them in person did no good. Saturday night, neighbors on the other side threw a party. People coming in and out of the room, screaming in the halls and in the room. Also playing loud music and other activities where we could hear every word through the walls. Four phone calls to the desk and a visit by the police still did not shut them up. I got to drive several hours home on 2 hours of sleep. The front desk would do little more than call the rooms of the inconsiderate people. The hotel seems more like a party place than a suitable place for anyone who wants to sleep. For a newish looking place, they did a pathetic job building the walls if there is absolutely no sound proofing. For all of my outrage, Sleep Inn only discounted me for 2 days of parking ($30). And at what hotel does one have to pay an extra $15 a day for parking? Lastly, a poor tourist family had their car window smashed in their parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Really peaceful decor, great location, wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sara_Bellum9
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I stayed here while attending a conference at another hotel. Although it took a bit of a walk to the other hotel, I learned after the first day that there was a free bus (the Circulator) that would pick me up right by the Sleep Inn and take me almost anywhere in the city! (Note: I don't know that all the staff were aware of this free bus, but it is really handy, so look it up if they don't have the info.) The rooms are spacious; the decor in my room was very simple and Zen-like, very restful. The breakfast was a normal continental breakfast, not too fancy but nice. The staff were great and did anything they could to help. Quite possibly the best hotel I've stayed in during the last two years (2010-2011)

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service, Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Crstor
Reviews.Content: I have never reviewed anything before. However, after the way my wife (who was having surgery at nearby Johns Hopkins) and I were taken care of, I had to share. The staff, particularly Keri, were so friendly and extremely helpful. She helped get us the room closest to the front door so that my wife did not have far to walk, gave us the best rates for our stay, answered our every need at all hours of the night, even helped track down and silence a barking dog! The rooms are beautifully maintained and a real bargain for the location. Shuttle to Johns Hopkins as well as right near the Inner Harbor of Baltimore for tourists. We will always return for any Baltimore stays we may have.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaminoe
Reviews.Content: We took a weekend trip to DC and found ourselves driving up to Baltimore on a whim. This was a very nice clean hotel. From the time we entered - the lobby, the halls, the rooms were clean and modern and even smelled nice. Our room was HUGE, the beds were comfy and the bathroom had a large newly tiled shower. The girls at the front desk gave us spot on directions to where we were going and where to stay away from. The hotel is not right in Inner Harbor but was a short walking distance to there and Little Italy. The Location is near an overpass but we never heard traffic. We were out past dark and never felt unsafe. I would definitely recommend this hotel. PROS: Clean, comfy beds, huge rooms, location and free breakfast. CONS: Parking fee but it seems as if every place in this area had them.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, the staff is AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: Swhiteman22
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler and this hotel meets my needs perfectly. It has a great location thats walking distance to the Inner Harbors restaurants and shopping. The rooms are large, continental breakfast, free wifi, happy hour, parking and an exercise room. The shinning star is the staff, they are GREAT (Keri), very fun and they make you feel like family. I recommend this location to all of my friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk "Sharmane" was absolutely on point for us, going out of her way to ensure a wonderful experience at this well appoint”
Reviews.Author: Juddeh
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, respectful guests handy location reasonably priced leaving me a well satisfied customer

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but some odd stuff”
Reviews.Author: NJDebster
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel in order to visit Johns Hopkins. It is very close to the hospital and the hotel has shuttle service back and forth - a big plus. My biggest issue was the odd shower. Our room was large and beautifully decorated. Very modern and nice blue/brown colors. But the bathroom was a little strange. The shower was in an alcove with no door or curtain. This made for a drafty shower. I did not like this at all. Water pressure was excellent though. As I said, the room was very large. The layout of furniture was odd due to this. The TV was not close enough to the beda for great viewing. No sofa as an alternative though one could have fit. The beds were comfy but the walls were a little thin. We could hear the TV and guests next door easily. The breakfast looked nice - the standard continental with waffles and some hot items. The staff were excellent and very helpful in every way. However, on the day we were to arrive, I tried to call the Front Desk and could not get anyone to answer. I called the national reservations like and they could not contact the hotel either. When I checked in, the Front Desk was unaware that there was any phone problem. Odd again . . . Be aware that you need to pay for parking. The lot was right next to the hotel. For some strange reason, they had very loud music piped outside the entrance. Not sure why but it was annoying. The rate for this hotel easily beat other similar hotels in the area. Also, after I voiced the same comments above on a guest survey, the hotel contacted me and gave me a partial refund. Obviously, they care about their customer's opinions. Would I stay again? Probably. I just wish the shower had a curtain.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Accommodations and Service”
Reviews.Author: Keith F
Reviews.Content: My sister was recently hospitalized in John Hopkins for major brain surgery. We had family drive to Baltimore to visit with my sister the day before her operation and stayed several days after her surgery to support her and each other during this difficult time. The accommodations and staff at the Sleep Inn were wonderful. They provided information for dining, travel directions, parking and simply made us feel at home. The entire facility was clean, organized and customer friendly. I want to sincerely thank everyone at Sleep Inn for allowing our family to concentrate on the wellness of my sister.

Reviews.Title: “mixed review ..clean, modern BUT...”
Reviews.Author: DeeMD215
Reviews.Content: For the most part i was pleased with the cleanliness and the modern look of the hotel, the area isn't the best, i wouldn't walk around at nite and location wise we actually keep getting lost even after checkin after we knew where it was. I got a deal thru a coupon online thing and got a good rate, but i don't think i'd pay full price for the facility. Our room was small with no tub just a shower that has one of those glass doors that doesnt move on side of the shower head and if your short you get a wet head trying to turn the thing on as you have to get inside to turn on..also the first nite we had a room with a horrible view of a backstreet where truckers and various other cars would park..it felt creepy when one car just stood there with lights on when i tried to pull the curtains in my pjs. They did provide us a new room the next nite..but the people at the desk at not very friendly or pleasant..nor helpful. We were suppose to have a bottle of wine with our package..and wanted it on Fri. nite as it was a special occasion but told the closet was locked and did not get it till the next nite after asking three times. Breakfast was ok..second day eggs and sausage was cold..fact another guest warned me and helped me use the microwave. Also no glasses in room..just paper or plastic cups and in first room the outlet for the coffee machine was behind large furniture i could not move..so used it in bathroom. Again..not a bad hotel but unless it's a good deal i don't think i'd return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: TwinMountain
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice one night stay at the Sleep Inn. The room was clean and spacious and the bed was very comfortable with great pillows. The shower was very strong and the photo art all around the hotel was attractive. The wifi was welcome as was the coffee in the breakfast area. Breakfast was just okay as the choices were very limited with cold cereal and waffles the primary offerings. Would have liked to see some proteins such as meat, eggs or even yogurt available. Parking is on-site and costs $15 per night. We had a nice conversation with Abraham Esquivel at the front desk and he was knowledgeable and a stellar ambassador for this property. A nice place to stay while in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Alice Z
Reviews.Content: My grandson had open heart surgery in November, 2011 at Johns Hopkins Hospital. When first enquiring about hotels in the area the biggest draw to Sleep Inn was the free shuttle to the hospital. We were so glad we chose Sleep Inn & Suites. From the first day we checked in we knew this was the best choice we could of made. We are from Kansas and this was not a vacation, but a very stressful time for my family. The check in was quick and easy, our shuttle driver was kind and willing to pick us up or take us to the hospital any time day or night. We made some wonderful friends with the staff and during those long hours after surgery it was nice to be able to come back to the hotel and relax. My husband needed to leave and if it wasnt for the staff of the hotel I would not of stayed by myself. I felt very comfortable being alone for a week and half because of the people who work for Sleep Inn. May God bless all of the employees at Sleep Inn and Suites. I highly recommend them for your next trip to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dia08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel very recently for one night while being on a business trip. We arrived very late, close to midnight and we met the manager at front desk. He was extremely nice and check-in was fast, we really felt welcomed! From the entrance the hotel gives you the impression of a very clean place with nice furnishings. The room was beautiful, very large with high ceilings and modern furniture. Bed was super comfy and everything was sparkling of cleanliness! Breakfast was free and had a good selection but being in a hurry I couldn't enjoy everything, had to quickly grab some cereals and leave. Overall was an excellent experience, the hotel being also a quiet place and I would definitely recommend it! It's more a 3 and a half star hotel for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sweeneyok
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel. It's a little ways (about 5 blocks) to walk to the harbor but the walk is pleasant and other than the dead of night I believe it's a safe walk. My trip was business and the young lady at the front desk was very helpful in giving me directions and getting me a ride to BWI. (Its' a driver in a big limo for $35) My room was spacious for the cost and very clean. Really nothing like the cheap chain hotel I expected. They even had breakfast included the next morning. It was quite a walk from the rail station but I did it at night in my boots and pack so anyone can.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend in Baltimore to celebrate my birthday. This hotel was fantastic! The rooms were beautiful, the price was right andmore than anything, the service was beyond amazing. Everyone we encountered was courteous and helpful. We asked for suggestions on where to eat. Not only were they able to offer a suggestion but they were also able to get a shuttle to take us there! Dinner was delicious in Little Italy and the shuttle service was so convenient! We will definitely come back since there is so much to do in Baltimore but mostly becasue our experience with Sleep Inn was surprisingly exceptional! Carrie, at the front desk, was extremely helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore Adventure”
Reviews.Author: pinguino792005
Reviews.Content: Thank you to the Sleep Inn & Suites Downtown Inner Harbor for a great experience on our recent stay. The Service was very courteous, friendly and helpful and the facilities were very spacious, clean, very convenient, free WiFi, very comfortable. The hotel is just a couple of minutes from most of the attractions the city has to offer. definitively will come back to this hotel in my future visits to the Baltimore City area.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAY - Roomy!”
Reviews.Author: teawings
Reviews.Content: Really love tripadvisor. Saw us through 15 days in Europe with accurate reports - and now again at Sleep Inn & Suites Downtown Inner Harbor in Baltimore, MD. Just like most say here - It was a EXCELLENT stay! Wonderful staff. Close to a lot of attractions and nice neighborhood walking nearby. Clean modern spacious room. I had my grand daughter and her friend with me - and we could have added 4 more to the room (on cots) and still not bump into each other. Think we had the largest bathroom I have ever seen (room there too for a person to sleep lol)! This will definitely be my hotel of choice when I am in the area again. The new upgrades in the hotel are evident. Great value for the money/area.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, fun and friendly place”
Reviews.Author: foq
Reviews.Content: The place was clean, the staff friendly, the rooms spacious, recently updated, heavenly bed, free wifi, what else could you possibly want? The only bone to pick is that it's not as near to the places I wanted to be as other hotels - but that's my own problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomadations, friendly, knowledgable staff, check out at noon”
Reviews.Author: Bolodenka
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new, clean and tastefully decorated with crisp colored lines from a soothing and most natural palette. Rooms have size and depth, beds, as we had a king size was spacious, plenty of pillows. Workstation and flat screen TV, full length closet and mirror, and bathroom with walk in shower with plenty of hot water and pressure. WiFI is free and so is printing, copying etc. Staff are here to make your stay comfortable, that was obvious, they are aware of you and think of what you might need before you need to ask. Parking can be tight, however we came in late and thought "oh no, where can I park?" well staff had us park off the road and in the entrance area, they take care of their own, so to speak.You wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JLSargent
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Rooms are awesome and clean. Staff was super friendly! Location was great as we could walk to the Inner Harbor. Would definately stay there again and recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but dont ask for fridge and microwave, will cost.”
Reviews.Author: Annette W
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel thinking it would be closer to Johns Hopkins were my husband was getting treatments. The room was nice and found out they did have shuttle to hospital liked advertised. What bothered me the most is when i went to ask for a room with fridge and microwave it would cost me $40 more a night. I had this hotel booked for 2 weeks, we stayed one night and booked with hotel that did not charge extra for fridge and microwave. We will be coming to Baltimore for my husbands treatments for 6 weeks and 2 days so being away from having these items just makes it a little easier being away from home. Being on a very tight budget we can not afford an extra $40 dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for downtown Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: civilwarguy
Reviews.Content: Here is a reasonably priced hotel with plentiful amenities, large rooms, friendly service and clean. The only drawback is its location, which is a good 15 minute walk to either the inner harbor or downtown attractions. The neighborhood is slightly menacing (not overly so but not the place you'd want your daughter to walk alone after dark). But for the $100 per night I paid, it is a good value. If you don't mind a walk and are not particularly squeamish about passing two blocks of homeless people sleeping and performing all other acts of the human anatomy a block from your hotel, I think you will feel good about staying here. Once inside, all is well.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay...just as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: CDNJehn
Reviews.Content: When returning to the Baltimore area we immediately booked this hotel again. Rooms are fairly large and nicely decorated. There is a large flat screen tv, desk area, good sized bathroom and the beds are COMFY. Hotel is in a renovated warehouse, lovely lobby area with huge ceilings and a nice sitting area. There is a computer and printer for guest use. I didn't use the fitness room but the machines looked quite new, looked really nice. The breakfast area has tables and a breakfast bar all along the windows. It gets busy, but people come and go quickly. Good selection of items, hot and cold. Location isn't where people would think of when they think 'inner harbor', but it's only about a 10 minute walk to the Aquarium, historic ships, and shops. There is a water taxi stop just down the street. 2 blocks from the restaurants at Power Plant Live, 15 minute walk to the pubs/shops in Fell's Point, 10 minute walk to Little Italy. The one downfall is that there is a church just down the street with a large park where a good amount of 'underprivledged' people were 'living'. I can see how that could make some people uneasy. We never had an issue walking by, but it didn't have the nicest smell when you pass. On our first stay at the hotel the desk clerk suggested was cab back from Little Italy if it was after dark. No concerns during the day though. My only complaint about the hotel is how heavy the room doors are. Our friends heard doors closing (slamming) quite often thoughout the night. Also, the bathroom door in our room wedged into the frame and made it impossible to quietly shut the door during the night. We did report that to the hotel when we checked out though. Isolated issue. Great stay overall

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a clean place to stay along with great staff”
Reviews.Author: mahaliacarter8
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice and had a pleasant experience each time. The hotel is fairly new in Baltimore so the prices for the rooms are not bad. You can walk to the harbor and downtown as well. The Shot Tower metro station is down the street as well so you can access mass transit here. The decor is beautiful and inviting. The only downside is that the walls are thin so you hear the room next to you if they are loud enough. The rooms are a great size as well. Second floor has a washer and dryer for guests to use. The hotel has an updated computer, printer and fax machine to take care of your business needs or you can use the wi-fi service in your room. Overall this is one of the best hotels I have stayed in without paying a five star price.

Reviews.Title: “Modern refurbishment of old building”
Reviews.Author: Park7
Reviews.Content: Location is 20 minutes walk to the convention centre. During our stay they did provide a free shuttle to the convention centre for one of the days. Room is modern and comfortable. Air condition was a little loud but overall I enjoyed the room. There is a small gym, free wifi and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, Great Staff, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lilemoevie
Reviews.Content: The Sleep Inn Inner Harbor is a great find - it's a little outside of downtown but located very close to Power Plant Live, the Aquarium and Harbor area/shopping plaza. It's about 1.5 Miles to Camden Yards/Ravens Stadium but it's all very walkable. The hotel itself is very nice and has a new feel - very boutiquey . The decor was very modern and not too busy. Beds were comfortable and the check in went very smoothly. Breakfast had a variety of items including eggs, sausage, waffle makers, cereal, fruit, muffins, breads etc. The hotel is also located within easy walking distance of Little Italy with a lot of great restaurants. Parking is $15 per night or you can park on the street at your own risk. They do have a computer in the lobby if you need to print your boarding pass or check your email. The front desk will also be glad to call cab for you if you need it! They do not have an airport shuttle but they do have a shuttle to bring you to John Hopkins if you need. One thing to note - our room only had a stand up shower, which may not work for some families with young children but for us it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “You'll be thrilled with your choice!!”
Reviews.Author: kimbodrisco
Reviews.Content: This property is an awesome find. Its a uniquely renovated furniture showroom and warehouse. The architecture style embraces what once was into a cool place to stay. The rooms and public areas are clean and the beds are comfortable. The staff is superb and very helpful. My husband has been staying there while working on a project nearby. Its a quick walk to the inner harbor and little Italy. Stay here, you'll be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ricshi
Reviews.Content: Place was clean, modern and new. Loved that it had a washer dryer you could use. The rooms were actually quite large and it wasn't to far from Inner Harbor. Free breakfast, Wifi and free lemonade whenever you want it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Free parking, wifi, breakfast and all new!”
Reviews.Author: BethlehemPaUSA
Reviews.Content: Only a 10 min walk down to the harbor or little Italy. My new jeep was fine parked in the hotels lot and we felt safe walking around at night. Clean and modern furnishings with showers and great water pressure. Kerri at check in was friendly, warm and helpfull. Very nice lobby felt more like a marriott than a sleep. The breakast was your standard no thrills but clean and hot, even though it was over at 9 we did not feel rushed after 9:15.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the Area!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pclaire1980
Reviews.Content: The staff is great, rooms are clean and beds are wonderful! The manager has bent over backwards to make sure that I had the best stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was pleasant - but location is sketchy”
Reviews.Author: jenitravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night for a Yankees/Orioles game. Decent distance from the Camden Yards, but sketchy walk and didn't feel 100% comfortable leaving my car in the lot. The hotel was very clean. The staff was very friendly. The bed was comfy and the bathroom was nice. If the rate was for the hotel alone I'd give it 5 stars, but for location it lost a point. Would not stay here again on location alone. Sorry but thanks for the hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: burnthiscity
Reviews.Content: I was a little wary booking this hotel only because a few reviews were quite negative.. but we loved it! Perfect location, only a few blocks from the inner harbor, and very well priced! We waited until the last minute (wanted to check in Sept 10, we bought the hotel Sept 10 in the early morning...) and we had had our sights on the Fairfield Inn but their prices went up to $179 a room. While it may have been nicer there, we got a king size bedroom at the Sleep Inn for $90 the day of check-in! You can't beat that! When we arrived we had no problem finding a parking spot (their spots are a little narrow if you have a bigger car, but we managed) and check in was a breeze. I didn't catch her name, but the woman at the desk was super nice. Our room was on the 2nd floor and it was super cute! I loved the colors (green and white walls, dark brown furniture). It gave the room a very earthy feel. It was a little stuffy when we first got in the room but we cranked up the air conditioning and it was soon very comfortable. Some pros and cons of the hotel Pros: - Great price and great location! The harbor was only a few blocks and we always felt safe. - Super friendly and helpful staff - Parking in their lot was only $15 a night, or there were spots right across the street. This is pretty cheap from other hotels we were seeing. They were super nice too - the next morning we checked out at 10am but they told us we could park there until around 3 or 4 when we came back from the aquarium and it wouldn't be a problem. - Awesome water pressure! And it was one of the only hotels I've stayed at where the floor doesn't get completely soaked after you take a shower... :) - Free continental breakfast! Nothing fancy but it was nice not to have to worry about finding something to eat early in the morning. It's only running until 9am though, so do you do need to wake yourself up in time. Cons: - Short of calling their customer support number, we couldn't get the free wireless internet to work. We tried on our iPhones, our iPad, and our laptop, tried various browsers... nothing! And my fiance is a computer technician, so he tried a million different things but ultimately he gave up. We could see the wireless network but couldn't get it to work =( - We are heavy sleepers so it didn't bother us so much, but like a few other reviews mentioned, the walls are kind of thin in comparison to other places. A few drunk guests came home around 1:30am (we went to bed around 10 because we are lame) but you could hear them perfectly when they were in the hallway (of course, they were also not trying to be quiet!) From our 2nd floor room you could also hear the music playing in the 1st floor lobby if you really strained to listen (it was very faint, but there). But it wasn't horrible by any means. Overall we really enjoyed our stay there and would definitly go back again! Great value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough...”
Reviews.Author: hopkinshoppers
Reviews.Content: Every time we stay in Baltimore, we stay at the Sleep Inn on Fallsway now. It's so reasonably priced, the best customer service we have ever had, and it's incredibly clean and safe. Management truly cares for you as a customer. It feels like family. The beds are fabulous, too, for those of you with bad backs.

Reviews.Title: “DEONDREA, you are amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Brittney F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a charity event held at the law firm directly behind this hotel. When we checked in, I informed Deondrea that it was also our first night out without our 8 1/2 month old daughter. Being my husbands boss was paying for the hotel we joked about room service and having chocolate covered strawberries and champagne delivered to our room on his expense. Deondrea said we don't have strawberries but we do have Twizzlers! We WERE kidding. However after a long day hosting the event we came back to the room and had a bottle of chilled champagne AND Twizzlers waiting for us!!! My husband and I toasted to the amazing day topped by Deondrea's amazing service! Thank you Hampton for employing the best of the Best!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - Clean and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: LaFave
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Downtown Inner Harbor hotel prior to going on a cruise. The manager Abraham was most accomodating to help us make our cruise transfers to and from the port. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. It is within walking distance to the Inner Harbor area. I strongley recommend the hotel for any stay in Baltimore Md. Make sure you use the stay and ride program for any cruise holiday, it will save you money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & service..and they go the extra yard for you!”
Reviews.Author: GUYMAC44
Reviews.Content: I organized a group trip to Baltimore to see a Yankee game that weekend. We organized the trip well before at a very fair rate. The hotel was very clean and modern. It was just a couple of blocks to the Inner Harbor and even less to a subway or bus stop. However, the customer service was beyond fantastic. Hurricane Irene was blowing by us during the middle of the weekend. The staff told us we could stay in the rooms as late as we needed on that Sunday(after the hurricane passed) til our bus returned. They also answered every inquiry with concise and polite answers and genuinely seemed tobe concerned about their customers and their stay at the hotel. The manager Abraham, a desk attendant Kerri and the group sales manager Lucy all stuck in my mind. I would definitely recommend this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a little way out”
Reviews.Author: pb1642
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are good - big, clean, with similar bathrooms. It's a little short on some amenities, e.g., no bar, no restaurant. A basic breakfast is served and there is a small exercise room. The main downside is its about 20 mins walk from the Inner Harbour area. Which is no hardship provided its not hot and humid as it was for this trip. We didn't have a car but to be honest that wasn't a big issue and given more temperate climate it would be great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice... But could be better!”
Reviews.Author: Ken D
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby and the staff was excellent! Rooms on first floor near elevator shold be sound proofed because you can hear loud groups of people coming and going all night. The breakfast menu should be expanded and the coffee and pastries should be replaced as they are eaten. The hotel needs to implement a shuttle because the cab drivers in Baltimore take advantage of tourist (10.00 to drive five blocks). Would I stay at this hotel again, it would depend on my budget.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Lori W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have always loved the Inner Harbor and decided to take a long weekend to go there for our 25th anniversary. I had bookd another Hotel which we had stayed at in the past and didn't like so I switched to the Sleep Inn at the last minute. The location was perfect, we could walk to every place we wanted to go. The staff was always pleasant. I watched one of the maids cleaning another room and was VERY impressed at how thorough she was, even washing the doors and desk tops! I would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “"It was GREAT"”
Reviews.Author: vici o
Reviews.Content: The BEST choice I made staying at the Sleep Inn Inner Harbor. The hotel was "NEW", the accommodation and the price you cannot beat that at all. The next morning we had a complimentary Continental breakfast and when we were ready to cruise on our excursion to the Caribbean they provided transportation to the cruise ship, " TO AND FROM ". We had the flight package which included the parking space for our vehicle until upon our return . My friend that worries about everything was completely satisfied . BEST CHOICE EVER !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgtsbud
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel. Very helpful staff. Great location to the inner harbor, it is an easy walk. Don't leave valuables in your vehicles as cars were broken into during my stay. My only criticism for the room is no refrigerators in the rooms. In my opinion this should be standard in every hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place to stay, very clean”
Reviews.Author: ktmk13
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and I decided to go to Powerplant Live for one night so we came down on a Friday. The place was very clean. Nothing special on the outside, but the inside is very nice. Most of the staff was pleasant and friendly. The only issue I had was with the night staff. I made my reservations online and had to book the two rooms separately due to last minute people deciding to join our group. I called two nights before our stay and I was put on hold for 15 minutes and after that I hung up. I called back the night before our stay and I explained to the person at the front desk that I booked the two rooms separately but I wanted to request that our rooms be next to one another...the guy on the phone was pretty rude and every question I had, his response was "I don't know". So my expectations were not very high after that. However, everything turned out fine and we were able to get rooms right next to each other once we checked in. We asked the front desk to call us cabs and they did, but they were not happy about it and were once again rude. Maybe these people are just not happy working the night shift. When we checked in, the people at the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful. So overall the expereince was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rcb63
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came here from CT to catch a Red Sox/Orioles game and we were both extremely pleased with our stay at Sleep Inn. Our room was extremely spacious, clean and had very modern, contemporary decor. Bed was very comfortable and the location of the room seemed very quiet as we were not able to hear anything from the surrounding rooms. My wife was very impressed by the decor of the entire hotel - it was very inviting and comfortable. The staff was helpful - they provided us recommendations on restaurants and other points of interest nearby when we asked them. On the morning of our check out, I discovered that I had lost my wallet. As I was in a state of panic - the front desk had informed me that the cab driver had found the wallet the night before and left his phone number for us to contact him. The staff was very sympathetic and called this gentleman to have him stop by and return the wallet. Rupert the cab driver from Diamond Taxi Service returned the wallet with all contents intact. If I have to find something that I didn't like - I would have to say that breakfast could probably be served a bit later than 9:00 am, and perhaps a few more towels in the room. I did read the review about some people felt unsafe in this area of town - apparently they were a bit intimidated by homeless people. My wife and I never felt unsafe or threatened in any way - even as we walked downtown, we passed people who happened to be less fortunate than us. This is to be expected in a city - we are not even from a city we are from a quiet, northeastern area of CT and were not intimidated by the "city culture". Besides, there were several police in the area. Will come back again and stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: aprilS72
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a really good location, you can walk almost anywhere from here. Its also quite safe as the police station is right there beside it. Its like it was built into an old warehouse, the hotel is a bit stark but pretty overall. We loved the windows. We didn't use parking but heard of others who did and they seemed to think it was a really good value. Overall a solid 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Great, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: goldngrm
Reviews.Content: My brother, niece and I stayed at this hotel while visiting my other brother in Johns Hopkins. The hotel was new, reasonable, extremely clean, with a full free breakfast and very courteous staff. We stayed from July 8-10 and rates were very low. The hotel was in a safe clean neighborhood of Baltimore and easily within walking distance of fine eateries and attractions. Also, parking rates were much lower than other hotels in the area. I would highly recommend it to travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great price”
Reviews.Author: Bethanne74
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in April while in town to see the Red Sox play at Camden Yards. The staff was friendly, the breakfast was delicious and the price was right. The rooms were comfortable and huge. As for the location, we: myself, my boyfriend and my nephew walked to and from Camden Yards. Did I see homeless people? Yes. They were however not in front of the hotel, but in a park a few blocks down the street. Did I at anytime feel unsafe while walking? In the daytime felt totally secure, but at night was a slight bit uncomfortable. On our first night there we went to Fell's Point and took a taxi back; so if you have a question about safety a taxi is an option and you can use the money you saved by staying here to pay for a few cabs. Will deginately be staying here the next time we want to catch the sox. When we were there parking was also not a problem. There were plently of spaces-but I'm sure the hotel was not full so that could be why the lot seemed so roomy.

Reviews.Title: “The best period.”
Reviews.Author: Sasoki
Reviews.Content: It was a great value with a decent breakfast and clean overall. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I had a wonderful stay at the Sleep Inn”
Reviews.Author: Ladyspice51
Reviews.Content: We loved it and we'll be back. I enjoyed my stay because the place was clean and quiet. They provided great service and they were knowledgeable . It is a safe environment . The hotel is next door to the police station. During my stay I didn't hear any noise. I didn't hear police sirens during my stay. The price was excellent because it was affordable without being a dump.

Reviews.Title: “I so love this hotel and the guys that work there!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brittney1002
Reviews.Content: Sleep Inn hotel is located downtown Inner Harbor which is a great location. You have all your favorite restaurants and more. Great hotel for you and your family. Sleep Inn have great service and the people that work there are amazing (Abraham and John :)). Parking is only $15 which is a low rate compared to the other garages and parking lots downtown Baltimore. I rather stay at this hotel any day!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Hawk42Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: What a nice place! Very convenient to the Inner Harbor, walking distance if you desire. Ample parking next to the Inn for a reasonable price. Warm and friendly front desk associates on all three shifts, who were helpful, courteous and gave great advice. Had a nice conversation with the General Manager, who made us feel right at home. Very good complimentary breakfast each morning in a clean and open area. Room was always spotless and bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept on during a vacation. We had a wonderful time here and for a great value. It was exactly what we were looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Never EVER again”
Reviews.Author: cpilotte
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel, along with my guests, for my wedding in downtown Baltimore in May 2011. My troubles with this hotel began right away with them promising me things for reserving a block of rooms for my guests and not following through, additionally, many guests had trouble booking rooms due to staff incompetence. In spite of the many problems I had before staying at this hotel, the staff assured me that me and my guests would have a good stay. Sadly, that was far from what we experienced. The hotel is very loud, anytime a door shuts on the same floor or anyone has a tv or music on, you can hear it in your room; none of the shower curtains were long enough to block water from going all over the floors; the parking lot is small and parking is not guaranteed, yet they do not tell you that you will be charged for parking even if you can't find a spot; some guests experienced parts of their rooms falling apart (light fixtures fell from the ceiling); some guests were woken at 12:30 AM to move their cars when they were parked legally in the small lot because cars were blocked in; and multiple guests reserved baby cribs/cots and were told they'd receive them having booked them early but were not given them when they checked in--yet, for some reason, there was a cot available in the room that my husband and I stayed in on our wedding night (I'm not sure who was supposed to be sleeping in that cot or why it was even there...). Yet, the biggest problem I had with the hotel was the attitude I was given at 6:00 AM the morning of my wedding day by a hotel staff member. I was attempting to pay for a parking spot for the hair & make-up women who we hired to help me and my bridesmaids get ready. This staff member had me stand there waiting about 5 minutes after asking to pay for a parking pass, then harassed me about why I had a free room (because it was my WEDDING DAY!), and did not resolve the situation and was exceptionally rude to me, so I paid for street parking instead. I did not have problems with any other staff members throughout my stay (despite numerous previous problems during the planning process) and some staff did respond to the problems we had when friends of mine described the problem I had with the morning staff member. Overall, I urge this staff to take more consideration in what they promise guests and to remember that customer service is probably one of the main things guests will remember. That said, staff at this hotel may want to refrain from using the words "My pleasure" after every interaction with a guest, because when a guest has problems with the staff/accommodations/anything, and the staff just repeatedly say "My pleasure" it comes off as rude, disrespectful, and completely not genuine. I do not recommend this hotel and I feel terrible for my wedding guests who stayed there and faced problems (which was most of them). Guests considering this hotel should be warned about the poor customer service, small parking lot & the possibility of being asked to move their car at odd hours of the night, and the already failing physical facilities of the hotel in general.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and great location for a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: darrell75
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the hotel. Comfortable and clean room. Easy walk to Inner Harbor Area.(10 min walk) Hotel attendant was very helpful and friendly. Recommend. The breakfast was very nice for continental style. We will return. Thanks from PA

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great waffles, will be back next time in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: sparkyy126
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in May. The hotel is in an EXCELLENT location walking distance to the harbor, little italy, and basically anywhere in Baltimore (if you dont mind walking). Its a 10-15 min walk to the harbor in a safe area. They also have the free bus that goes throughout the city so you can easily walk to the bus stop (8 min) and get anywhere in Baltimore. The hotel is clean, modern, and breakfast buffet includes the waffle maker which is great. Other than the waffles breakfast is basic. Only complaint about the hotel is the walls are thin and you hear everything. If you are a light sleeper it could be a problem. The first night we were next to a few people drinking/listening to loud music all night. The next morning reception was more than willing to switch our room but since they had checked out we figured it would be ok. Next people to check in had a crying baby. Like I said walls were thin but that is the only complaint. Also there was an incident where they had cleaned the elevator and I walked in an fell. We told reception and they had it taken care of right away. There were no signs or anything posted. But it was in such a good location and we really liked the waffles. We would stay there again next time we are in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-easy walk to everything”
Reviews.Author: wolfeman13
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this spot. We could walk to every thing in Baltimore, about 1 mile to Camden yards. They have an active waterfront area along the way. Lots of restaurants and bars to break things up. Good breakfast. It is located next to a church which has a courtyard where homeless people sleep at night. We did not encounter any of them but it was enough for us with the poor lighting in the area that we took a cab at 11PM.

Reviews.Title: “Johns Hopkins Univ patient”
Reviews.Author: panther53934
Reviews.Content: My mother and I recently stayed at the Sleep Inn Downtown/Inner Harbor. I am A patient of Johns Hopkins Bayview Medical Center. We arrived on a Tuesday at 3pm and were promptly checked in. The Hotel is brand new and very clean. Our room was spacious, clean, and well maintained. I had brain surgery scheduled for Wednesday morning at 8am. We needed to leave the hotel at 7am. The general manager, Abraham Esquivel, came in early and personally drove us to the Hopkins Bayview Campus. He got us there in 20 minutes with plenty of time to spare! I had my surgery and had to spend the night in nuerological ICU while my mother went back and spent the night at the hotel. The staff at the Sleep Inn bent over backwards to comfort and take care of her that night. She said she slept like a baby. Just what she needed after a very long stressful day! I was released from the hospital the next day and the general manager came with my mother and picked me up at the front door of the hospital and brought us back to the hotel and we checked out. Because the Sleep Inn is affiliated with Hopkins Medical Centers we recieved discounts for the room and parking. I would recommend this hotel for anyone being treated at the Hopkins Medical Centers.

Reviews.Title: “Great n Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Twin_mommy8785
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the Sleep Inn n Suites Inner Harbor. All I can say is we will be back baby. Great Staff n Breakfast. Convenient location n price. Love the decor

Reviews.Title: “Best stay away from home in the Baltimore area!!”
Reviews.Author: scoochmom
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sleep Inn & Suites Downtown Inner Harbor in Baltimore, MD and my experience was OUTSTANDING! From the time I made my reservation to the time of check-out I was treated like a VIP! The customer service at this location was top-notch and I will recommend this hotel to all of my business associates when traveling to the Baltimore area. I give my experience a 10 out of 10!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but Sketchy Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: 2doglove
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night in late April. Since we were to be arriving late and leaving early the next morning, I was interested in finding value-oriented lodging and this hotel fit the bill. When we arrived I was a bit nervous. We felt very much as if we were in a BAD part of town as there were choppers circling continually overhead with spotlights searching the ground. Not a great welcome. But we were able to park conveniently next to the hotel for free and once we were inside we felt much more comfortable. The hotel was fairly clean and the receptionist was nice. Our room was strange...HUGE...with incredibly high ceilings and lots of empty space. The bed was very comfortable and we slept well. Shower and bath were clean and acceptable. It's not where I would stay again if I wanted to do any walking around or sight seeing, but I would be fine to stay for a quick overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Did not feel comfortable staying here.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler9941
Reviews.Content: I tried posting this the day we returned, but Trip Advisor never posted it. So, I will try again. Based on many positive reviews on Trip Advisor, I booked a room here for a weekend of sight-seeing in Baltimore with my husband and young child. When we drove up to the hotel, there were over 20 men, who appeared to be homeless, hanging around outside the hotel. Some were laying down, and appeared to be sleeping in the grass across the street from the hotel. Since we were planning to walk to the Inner Harbor with our young child, and perhaps walk back after dark after dinner, we decided we did not feel comfortable staying at this hotel. We found a comparably priced hotel a few blocks closer to the Harbor. I am very curious about this, because no other posters have mentioned this issue. I wonder if it was a one-time thing - did we just coinicindentally happen upon a one-time free-meal or other assistance program? The only thing I could compare the scene we experienced to is what I have seen when a shelter or church meal program is about to open. Trip Advisor - this is a legitimate review of my experience with this hotel. I'm not sure why it "disappeared," but other travelers should be able to see it and the hotel management should be able to comment and explain. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jlksul
Reviews.Content: Three friends and myself traveled to Baltimore last weekend to attend The Preakness at Pimlico Racetrack, I chose the Sleep Inn in downtown Baltimore, it was a good choice, The price was reasonable, the room which was a suite was extremely roomy and the whole hotel was extremely clean, In addition the location was close to downtown, Fells Point, the inner harbor and all the sports stadiums. Th staff was friendly and efficient, the woman at the front desk, Anita Patel, took care of our every need. I can't wait to stay there again

Reviews.Title: “No Sleep Inn - Avoid despite previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: youwishyouknew
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent, and considering the great reviews this hotel had, we decided to stay here (to visit Baltimore) for two nights prior to going to a wedding in DC. We like to see places before we send clients to them. This is the 3rd review I've every made on a hotel and it is the first negative one. The hotel is decent - modern and clean with usual Sleep Inn amenities like a decent breakfast. I am not at all picky and look for good value. It is a moderate walk to the Inner Harbor and that walk is fairly safe. However, I spent a rather busy morning working from my room (ok wi fi with your laptop), went to the inner harbor for lunch and came back to rest prior to going out for the evening. There was no rest to be had on the 2nd floor. Several rooms had their doors open and were partying hardy carrying drinks thru the halls and almost screaming at each other. I would have expected security to pick this behavior up and try to contain it (it is a smallish hotel). That did not happen. Went out for the evening and returned at about 1 am and got 1 hour sleep before all hell broke loose in the adjacent (several) rooms and corridor. I know this is the Preakness wkend, but that is no excuse for a hotel openly letting thier property become an all night party for yahoos. We were awaken about 2:30 am with the same nonesense going on. I got dressed, went out to see what was happening and found several rooms with loud parties or arguments going on. Don't really know if these were Preakness folk or not but it was really loud. Went down to the front desk to see if they could do something, but quickly realized that the front desk person was involved with the revelers as was the security guard. I felt that if I said anything I might actually put myself in danger. I must say that the early evening front desk person was very nice, but the night person is a blooming idiot and party person that can not be approached (unless you are one of the chicks from the party crowd). I'm obviously still not asleep at 3:30am and annoyed enough not to sleep much tonight. I have stayed at many Sleep Inns and never had an experience like this. Definitely never again here, nor any of my clients. I cannot believe the good ratings this hotel has received. Giving the benefit of the doubt, I will try to say it was bad timing, but it is sufficient to turn me off to this property. I will suggest to you and my clients, the Fairfield Inn (closer to the Inner Harbor) or even Pier 5, where you can almost equivalent rates if you look carefully (less the breakfast). Too bad, but I am really dissappointed in the NO Sleep Inn and Suites, Baltimore Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: cadehaven
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while my son was a patient at Johns Hopkins. One of the reasons I chose this hotel was because of the free shuttle to the hospital. The rate was great and the room spacious and clean. I had the same problem with water all over the floor after a shower. Longer shower curtains would be most helpful. The shuttle service was not as dependable as it could be. They acknowledge that there are some issues and say they are working on them. Other than that, this is a nice hotel and the staff is very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: americangrl
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were all wonderful- check in was easy, parking was easy and the room was fabulous- clean..and the beds.... sooo comfortable!! The breakfast was nice.. Close to inner harbor,, just a 5 block walk to inner harbor and sooo close to little italy.. Great location, safe location. Really enjoyed my stay here and would stay again... Only complaint was the room was facing the road and it was a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “This Place was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: The_Myers_Family
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write reviews for hotels but after staying here I just felt compelled to do so. When I saw the review about the hotel not being responsive to families I got a little worried.... But in actuality the Sleep Inn FAR EXCEEDED my expectations. If you want a great modern room for a decent price in Baltimore- This is the place to go! We were a large family and asked for adjoining rooms as well. The Front Desk Staff indicated that it was first come first serve so we understood we had to take our chances... Luckily we got 2 rooms with adjoining doors! I travelled with my parents and my kids and we had 4 rooms in total. All rooms were large and well appointed. The breakfast was great as well. All in all I will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “So disappointed..”
Reviews.Author: jamhog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a feeling there would be a problem when we checked in since the reservation process was so painful.
