We specifically asked for adjoining rooms for our family of five and my husband called twice to confirm with two different managers, but when we arrived we were told they only had two king rooms that were not even next to each other. It is a newly constructed hotel, but the quality is not there. There are stains on the carpet, the rooms are small, beds are uncomfortable, you can hear the people above you and next door, you know when someone is taking a shower, and being right by a major roadway be prepared to hear sirens and trucks all night. None of us slept and it was not a nice area at all. We were supposed to stay two nights, but ended up checking out the next morning at 8am. I would not recommend this hotel and will never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Carol210
Reviews.Content: In town for a Cirque show and just stayed overnight. The room was large enough and could have accommodated an extra chair/couch. The only other sitting area was the bed besides the desk chair. The king bed was comfortable as were the pillows and were able to get a good night sleep from the lack of noise from the hallway and street. Temperature controls were good. The bathroom was a large space with a walk-in shower which flooded the floor since the shower curtain wasn't long enough to keep the water from dripping off the curtain over the edge. Bath towels on the small and thin side. If you're a late sleeper, forget the complimentary breakfast which closes at 9:00 AM everyday. The hotel still reflected it's newness since opening in Dec 2010. The small surcharge for parking turns out to be $15.00/night. Front desk helpful and was able to provide replacements for forgotten toothbrush and toothpaste. We took advantage of the free restaurant shuttle to/from Mo's Seafood restaurant which saved us from having to find/pay for parking. If the shuttle is picking up/dropping off or making a carry-out delivery, you may get a mini-tour of the city as we did before we arrived at the restaurant. We did not do, but could walk the 4-5 blocks to the nearest inner harbor site, but would be a longer walk to the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: sightseeing1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed staying at this hotel. It was very clean and comfortable, Ultra modern. The staff was very helpful and helped us to get around the city and offering good public transportation tips. Overall the stay was very good. We only had two pet peeves, 1- the shower in our room was a stall type setup and the water spilled out of the shower onto the floor and the breakfast time ended too early for us, but the quality of the meal and display was very warm and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service & Huge Room for a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Pigaway
Reviews.Content: This place is excellent quality and service for the price. The hotel is brand new, and our ground floor room was quiet, had incredibly high ceilings, and was so spacious it felt like more furniture was needed just to fill it up. Abraham, the General Manager, went above and beyond to help us out during our brief, but memorable stay. In addition to offering a great rate, he agreed to extend the amount of time we could keep our car in their parking lot (since they weren't full the following night) so that we could visit the Aquarium (within walking distance) after checking out. The Sleep Inn's $15 parking fee is cheaper than other Inner Harbor hotels (which also charge an additional night's parking fee to stay past noon). We ended up having problems with our car on the way there, and the front desk staff was very accommodating as we arranged to have a repair service come to their parking lot. Staff let us have some eggs after they put away their free breakfast and were willing to show the repair service to our car so we wouldn't have to wait for the truck to arrive, and Abraham extended our check out time so we could go to the Aquarium like we planned. Even though our car trouble wasn't their fault, they made sure it didn't ruin our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Location, & The Price Is Just Right”
Reviews.Author: CrazieJohn
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. 5 minutes from the Powerplant Live and not more than a 10-15 minute walk from the other main attractions at the Inner Harbor. Staff were great, helpful, and friendly. The rooms are huge with lots of move-around space.The waffle-maker in the morning is the best. You better wake up early to enjoy the taste of those hot waffles covered in syrup and whipped cream.

Reviews.Title: “great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: erk
Reviews.Content: just opened a few mths ago - excellent location for Inner Harbor - everthing easily accessible walking several blocks. warm reception by hotel staff, extremely comfortable room, very nicely designed and decorated, convenient parking at $15/nt in adjacent lot, breakfast included. highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget choice”
Reviews.Author: tgl
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my daughter to look at a school. The hotel is located right next to the beginning of Interstate 83. It is a little hard to find the first time, driving up. The easiest way coming from the Inner Harbor area on Gay Street was to turn right _immediately_ after passing under Interstate 83. One can also take the last possible right turn after taking the 83 North on-ramp from S President. The hotel sign is a small purple and white sign near the top of the 4 story red brick building. There is a sign at ground level that is hard to see from either approach until you are right there. There is a large lot right next to the hotel that filled up Saturday night but was easy to park in on Thursday when we arrived. Our booking was pre-paid via Hotels.com and included parking but there is a sign posted about a $15/day fee. Check-in is painless. The lobby is contemporary with a striking green, white and wood design and very high ceilings. The elevator lobby has one wall of bare cement that gave it a very interesting accent. The elevator itself is very slow but there is plenty of room for luggage. The room had two queen beds with good linens and comforter. Between beds there is a nightstand with two lamps and a clock. There were 4 feather pillows per bed. Above each headboard were two framed pictures of outdoor scenes (See photo). There is a desk with flat screen TV mounted above and a single desk chair. There is a lot of floor space because there is no other furniture. Ceilings are 10 feet high even in the bathroom. Carpet is a no nonsense commercial grade. The bathroom in our room had a walk in shower and no bath. If you don't need a bathtub, it is quite nice. Hot water was available very quickly, but the control did not have very fine control, so some care is needed to get the temperature right. We heard a couple fighting out in the hallway one night, but we would have heard them in any other hotel I've ever been in. Otherwise, the nights were quiet with very few sounds entering from outside. Street noises could be heard only if the window was open. The black out curtain was very effective keeping out sunlight. Wireless internet was free and simple to start, and the service was consistently fast even with a full hotel. It's unsecured, so I ran my VPN, and had no problems. There is no safe for laptops. Breakfast is OK with omelets one morning as a hot item otherwise, there is instant oatmeal and cook-it-yourself waffles, cold hard-boiled eggs, toast, bagels and cereals, juices, mild and coffee. The breakfast area to the side of the lobby is bright with 4 tables and one long bar. Oddly, there was only one trash receptacle. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Aquarium at the Inner Harbor and about 30 minutes to the convention center, so the hotel is pretty conveniently placed. No view, nothing luxurious about the place but with the price we paid, this was a great bargain. I suppose a professional rating service would give it a 3 out of 5 rating because of lack of restaurant, room-service etc, but it's definitely at the head of the line for budget hotels. The 3/5 for the room is because of the lack of a second chair and lack of a safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Cute Place”
Reviews.Author: Whiterabbit_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sleep Inn and Suites early March, its a nice cute place. It is clean and comfy. I like how the rooms are big and there is plenty of room to put luggage and bags around the room. Our main focus for the trip to Baltimore was the Aquarium which was loads of fun. This hotel was pretty close to the Aquarium and the staff were super frendly. We called in advanced cuz we got lost and the Manger on duty made sure we got to the hotel with the quickest route. I would def recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wonderful Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Matt_and_Jenna
Reviews.Content: After a nightmare start to our vacation dealing with another hotel's many shortcomings, we were directed to the Sleep Inn & Suites in Baltimore. THESE PEOPLE SAVED OUR FIRST ANNIVERSARY VACATION! They made us feel special and took care of everything we needed. The hotel is located next door to a police station, so we had no concerns about the usually scetchy areas in Baltimore. The hotel is BEAUTIFUL! A spacious lobby complete with water features welcomes you to what is sure to be a great stay. The entire staff was gracious and polite. We even met the owner, which is very rare in our experiences at other hotels. We stayed in a spacious suite complete with jacuzzi tub which was very worth the money. Breakfast was great and the location is 2 minutes from all Inner Harbor attractions. Stay at this hotel! You will NOT be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: alruiz89
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Sleep Inn Friday 4 March with my coworker after working the graveyard shift at my job downtown. The complimentary breakfast was delicious (make your own waffles!!!) and the staff and managers were incredibly friendly. Check-Out time was at 11:00am, however the owner himself was friendly enough to extend it to 1pm after empathizing with our tired state as clerks coming off a grave-yard shift. Highly recommend it to anyone looking for a hotel with great rooms and amazing service at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Best value downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Svrkljan67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem. excellent staff and service. Beautiful room with a lot of amenities. Excellent breakfast provided!! Will stay here again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Charm Cities Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: 2Travelers2Dogs
Reviews.Content: Just a few short blocks from Baltimore’s famed Inner Harbor and minutes from Johns Hopkins Medical Center you'll find the Sleep Inn Inner Harbor Hotel. My husband and I were going to be in Baltimore for several days of testing at Johns Hopkins Medical Center. After calling several of the hotels on the Johns Hopkins preferred hotel list we chose the Sleep Inn Inner Harbor. There were several things that factored into our choice, one being the close proximity to the hospital and the other being that they offered shuttle service to and from the hospital throughout the day but the main reason we chose the Sleep Inn was the hotel manager Abraham. From our first phone call Abraham bent over backward to accommodate our every need. Even when inclement weather forced us to move up our travel date at the last minute he simply said "no problem" and had our room ready and waiting when we arrived a few hours later. He's always out front, never hiding in the office and wants to know everything about your experience and how he can make the hotel a better place for future guests. He's truly is an Innkeeper, the likes of which you just don't find much anymore, especially at a discount chain hotel. From start to finish this property did not disappoint. The hotel has the fresh appeal of a boutique hotel. Beautiful lobby and large spacious guest rooms with comfortable bedding make your stay feel more like a night at a luxury hotel for a third of the price. The shower was always hot and the water pressure amazing. The bathrooms are up to date with granite countertops and great lighting with more than enough room to move around without feeling cramped. It was a great place to come home to at the end of a long day at the hospital. The high speed internet was also one of the fastest I've encountered in a hotel. Totally free and lightning fast -- it will impress. So, if you're a business traveler who needs to work from your room or a social networker catching up on the latest status updates you won't be disappointed. I can't rave enough about the staff. Friendly and helpful doesn't even scratch the surface they truly bent over backward to make sure that we had everything we needed including a replacement fridge long after the maintenance staff should have gone home. No request was too trivial or too outlandish and they were always there with a smile no matter what. Whether you're in Baltimore on business or pleasure you'll get a grand hotel feel at a budget hotel price and I promise you'll walk away from this place wishing you could stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Multistradaguy
Reviews.Content: Well we arrived at the Hotel at 4:30pm and check in is 3:00pm, our room was not ready yet, but our other room was half ready... sheets but no bed spreads. So we brought 8 peoples worth of luggage to the one room. We decided to walk to the harbor as it is only 0.5 mile walk and there were no more parking spots left in the lot and the street parking was limited. When we walked back from dinner at 8pm, we were told our rom was still not ready as the previous guests did not leave until 6:00pm. So we had no choice but to all hang out in one room until we get a call. They said it would be ready in 20 minutes. We are still waiting and it's 8:30pm...

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: Chrisshop
Reviews.Content: I stayed ay this brand all over the United States, howevrr by far this was my best experience. Myself and my wife stayed for the weekend, and from the time we arrived until we checked out the service was 4 stars or better. The staff great you by name, the took our bags to the room, and even took the time to call the room to make sure we were comfortable. If you ever get a chance to go to Baltimore this is the place you want to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel, take advantage of deals while you can”
Reviews.Author: ian206
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the brand new Sleep Inn & Suites shortly after it opened, in part because they were offering a great deal. The hotel was great--spacious rooms, comfortable king bed, and attentive staff. The breakfast was simple but good. We stayed in a pet-friendly room and our dog loved it. The location is convenient to downtown and to Johns Hopkins (the latter of which was the "excuse" for our trip), although the immediate vicinity admittedly isn't all that great (not much within walking distance).

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value”
Reviews.Author: ArdiesTravels
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here during a visit to Baltimore. From the minute we walked into the lobby, we could see the place was brand new. The airy, exposed brick lobby is definitely an unexpected surprise for a Sleep Inn or ANY hotel in this price range. The front desk staff was very helpful...we had just arrived after a long drive and they recommended several good options around the hotel and completed the check-in process quickly. As for our room, we stayed in the Jacuzzi Suite which was surprisingly classy!!! The room is well appointed with brand new furniture, a flat screen TV, comfortable mattress, pillows, comforters and towels. The owner or designer definitely made an effort to decorate the rooms well. The location is great if you want to be in the Inner Harbor and take advantage off Baltimore's best restaurants, bars, attractions and nightlife. Whenever we come back to Baltimore, this is the only hotel we will stay at. It is one of the reasons our trip to Baltimore was so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bang for your Buck!”
Reviews.Author: dsmooth84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Sleep Inn for business in late December. I travel almost 80% of the year and regularly stay at Marriott and Hilton Properties. This hotel was at the same level as those if not better. My room WAS BRAND NEW. The manager mentioned that they had just opened, but they ran it like it had been there forever. The staff gave the impression that they had been working there for years and everything was well organized and maintained. If I'm ever back in Baltimore for business OR to catch a game and see my Beloved Red Sox play, I'll definitely be booking a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and friendly helpfulness with charm and style!”
Reviews.Author: kp121
Reviews.Content: The Sleep Inn is one of those Hotels, that did not have the look or feel like a chain hotel. The rooms were spacious and clean. It has an ideal location near Baltimore Convention Centers, Camden Yards, and the local scenery. Not only was this hotel was brand new, but the service was also impeccable. I was really surprised how well run it was. If you want to hang out in Baltimore, this has the ideal location for you to experience what Baltimore is really all about.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBVEGA
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to take some time off and just relax and we found the perfect hotel. This hotel was very, very comfortable. I will definitely come back all the time when visiting Baltimore, MD. The staff was awesome, so helpful especially the General Manager, Abraham, YES, he was available not hidden in an office! Abraham is awesome! The check in and check out was quick. Breakfast was very good. Everything was clean. Access to the internet was easy and fast. This place is in a great location. I would definitively recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel in Baltimore with a unique boutique feel.”
Reviews.Author: NyTraveler_567
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for a last minute business trip from NY. It was easy to get to from Penn Station and had a great New York boutique feel. Service was good and overall the room was a great value and style for the price.

HotelInfo.Name: Sleep Inn & Suites Downtown Inner Harbor
HotelInfo.Address: 301 Fallsway, Baltimore, MD 21202
